fields.physical_description:
Design: high quality rad paper with an uncoloured engraving which is probably taken from an early block or based upon a design of about 1725-50
No. of squares: 56
Squares illustrated: some
Square numbering: all
Squares titled: all
Subject of starting square: borsa, purse
Subject of ending square: fortuna, luck/fortune
fields.title: giuoco dei personaggi
fields.history_note:
embossed at the bottom of the game
Stamperia Vicenzi Edizioni Remondiniane Bassano per PIAZZESSI LEGATORE in VENEZIA
There is no true translation of the game but it is a forfeit and reward type with moral overtones more like Kismet (Snakes and Ladders) where landing on a particular square will mean advancing or retreating.
fields.production_note: f. amatruda amalfi (water mark on paper)
fields.historical_context_note:
Rewards: FORWARD MOVEMENT
Forfeits: BACKWARD MOVEMENT; pay 1 token
No. of Players: ANY
Equipment required: markers
dice


Rules:
It is a race game with an oval track of 56 numbered squares, each with a named illustration  and  a central illustration showing a pair of men battling in front of a building.  Three corners are filled with a triangle showing a floral pattern; the fourth, lower left, shows a building.  There is no true translation of the game but it is a forfeit and reward type with moral overtones more like Kismet (Snakes and Ladders) where landing on a particular square will mean advancing or retreating.

TITLES AND INSTRUCTIONS TO EACH SQUARE ARE AS FOLLOWS:-

1.  Borsa, purse
2.  Casa, house
3.  Gabbia, cage
4.  Corbiere, knight on horseback, instruction `al.N.9'
5.  Maccaroni, standing pot
6.  Cuore, stabbed heart, heart/love
7.  Gatto, cat, instruction `al N.20'
8.  Stendardo,flag/standard
9.  Posta, building, post or post office
10.  Sorcio, mouse/rat, instruction `al No.16'
11. Leone, lion
12.  Oste, innkeeper, instruction `al N. 17'
13.  Canarin, canary, instruction `al N.3'
14.  Cupido, Cupid, instruction `al N. 6'
15.  Pulcinela, Punch, instruction `al N. 5'
16.  Trapola, trap
17.  Osteria, inn, instruction `Paga 1'
18.  Face, torch
19.  Bosco, tree/forest
20.  Gatto, cat
21.  Cacio,cheese
22. Cavallo, horse, instruction `al No.26'
23.  Arlechin, Harlequin, instruction `al N.21'
24.  Dadi, dice, instruction `Vieni qui', a pair of either dice shown  must be thrown before moving on
25.  Gobbo, hunchback, instruction `al N.30'
26.  Sedia, carriage
27.  Fanale, lantern
28.  Tazza, goblet
29.  Cacciato(re), huntsman, instruction `al N.19'
30.  Monte, mountain
31.  Bacco, Bacchus, instruction `al N.54'
32.  Albero, tree
33.  Prigion, prison
34.  Povera, beggar, instruction `al N.45'
35.  Soldato, soldier
36.  Malvasia, wine casks, instruction `paga 1'
37.  Orto, gate, possibly a garden gate
38.  Gallo, cock, instruction `al N.53'
39.  Libreria, library
40.  Luna, moon
41.  Maschera, masked figure
42.  Pavone, peacock
43.  Pescatrice, fisherman
44.  Nave, ship, instruction `al N.51'
45.  Ponte, bridge, instruction `paga 1'
46.  Dama, lady, instruction `al N.50'
47.  Dottore, doctor, instruction `al N.39'
48.  Maschere, masked figure, instruction `al N.36'
49.  Matto, the Fool, instruction `al N. 40'
50.  Specchio, mirror
51.  Porto, port, instruction `paga 1'
52.  Parigin, Paris-male figure, instruction `al N. 41'
53.  Gallina, hen
54.  Botte, barrel
55.  Ladro, thief, instruction `da capo'; this can be to start again from square 1 or to quit the game 
56.  Fortuna, fortune or luck, instruction `Hai Vinto', you have won.

Rules placement: none
